oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Development of prevention and treatment strategies for parasites in poultry
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Maurer, Veronika
Amsler, Zivile
Heckendorn, Felix
Perler, Erika
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Poultry
Health and welfare
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Parasitic infections are likely to be more important in organic and other free-range hens than in birds kept indoors. Several workpackages of QLIF aim at improving prevention and therapy of helminth (Ascaridia galli and Heterakis gallinarum) and arthropod (Dermanyssus gallinae) parasites of laying hens. This paper is a summary of the work undertaken in the first 3 years of QLIF.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Maurer, Veronika; Amsler, Zivile; Heckendorn, Felix and Perler, Erika (2007) Development of prevention and treatment strategies for parasites in poultry. Paper at: 3rd QLIF Congress: Improving Sustainability in Organic and Low Input Food Production Systems, University of Hohenheim, Germany, March 20-23, 2007.
